content:
I'm glad you found the previous suggestions helpful!

Regarding your struggle with feelings of inadequacy and self-doubt, I think it's essential to recognize that social media often presents a curated version of others' lives, making it easy to compare and feel inferior. It's great that you're aware of this and willing to make changes.

Considering your recent argument with your best friend, it's understandable that you might be more prone to feelings of inadequacy and self-doubt. However, it's excellent that you've been working on maintaining a healthy friendship and focusing on the positive aspects of your relationship.

To build upon the previous suggestions, I'd like to ask: Have you considered journaling or reflecting on your thoughts and feelings? Writing down your thoughts can help you identify patterns and gain insight into your emotions. Additionally, it might be helpful to set aside time for self-reflection, whether it's daily, weekly, or monthly, to focus on your goals, achievements, and
